# Tender for Facilitation Services for Salmon Allocation Policy Review (Phases 2 – 4)

## Summary
Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites qualified consultants to provide facilitation services for the Salmon Allocation Policy Review (SAPR) process, spanning Phases 2 to 4.

### Tender Details

* **Reference Number**: PW-22-01010246
* **Amendment Number**: 1
* **Solicitation Number**: 30002058
* **Publication Date**: October 17, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: November 7, 2022, 14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: Not specified
* **Expected Contract End Date**: Not specified
* **Tender Status**: Expired

### Background
The 1999 Salmon Allocation Policy sets out principles for salmon allocation and priority in British Columbia among three harvest groups (First Nations Food, Social and Ceremonial; commercial fisheries; and recreational fisheries). The policy guides annual domestic allocations of salmon in the Pacific Region.

### Objective
The objective of the engagement for the SAPR process is to work with First Nations and stakeholders via working groups and periodic broader consultation and engagement. The Contractor will gather information, share perspectives, and conduct analysis to support the development of policy options, collaboratively develop and consider policy options, and develop policy recommendations for an updated SAP in British Columbia.

### Scope of Work
The Contractor must convene and facilitate up to twelve (12) working group meetings of the following bodies to guide the review of the Pacific Salmon Allocation Policy:

1.  First Nations – DFO Committee
2.  Multi-Party Working Group
3.  Multi-Party Technical Working Group
4.  Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement

### Ownership of Intellectual Property
Fisheries and Oceans Canada has determined that any intellectual property rights arising from the performance of the Work under the resulting contract will belong to Canada.

### Period of Contract
The period of contract shall be from the date of award to March 31, 2023, with the possibility of extending the contract by up to 2 (two) additional 1 (one) year period(s) under the same conditions.

### Invited Suppliers
The following suppliers have been invited to participate in this tender:

*   Bentley, Shannon A
*   Pacific Blue Consulting
*   Global Energy Minerals and Markets Dialogue
*   Indigenuity Consulting Group
*   JCA Cullington & Associates
*   Dov
